info.description: Production resource management shall be defined as the collection of activities that manage the information about resources required by production operations, and relationships between resources. The resources include machines, tools, labour (with specific skill sets), materials and energy, as defined in the object models given in ISA-95 Part 1. Direct control of these resources in order to meet production requirements is performed in other activities, such as production dispatching and production execution management. Management of information about segments of production is also an activity in resource management. Management of the resource information may be handled by computer systems but it may be partly or entirely handled by manual processes. Management of the resources may include local resource reservation systems to manage information about future availability. There may be separate reservation systems for each managed critical resource. There may be separate activities for each type of resource, or combined activities for sets of resources.  Information about resources and relationships between resources needed for a segment of production must be maintained and provided on the available, committed and unattainable capacity for specific periods of time of specified resources as defined in ISA-95 Part 1.

MaterialLot.description: A representation of a uniquely identified specific amount of material, either countable or weighable shall be named as a material lot. A material lot describes the planned or actual total quantity or amount of material available, its current state, and its specific property values. A material lot may be tested by the execution of a material test specification.

id.description: A unique identification of a specific material lot, within the scope of the information exchanged (production capability, production schedule, production performance, …) The ID shall be used in other parts of the model when the material lot needs to be identified, such as the production capability for this material lot, or a production response identifying the material lot used.

version.description: The version number of this instance of the Material Lot.

status.description: Status of the material lot. For example, released, approved, blocked, in process, in quality check.

description.description: Additional information about the material lot.

storageLocationId.description: An identification of the storage location or a physical location of the material lot.

quantity.description: The quantity of the material lot.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated quantity, if applicable.

effectiveFrom.description: The timestamp that this state of the Material Lot is effective from.

effectiveTo.description: The timestamp that this state of the Material Lot expires.

spatialDefinition.description: The location or footprint of this Equipment item.

MaterialLotProperty.description: Each material can have unique values for zero or more material lot properties, such as a specific pH value for the specific lot of material, or a specific density for the lot of material. A material lot property may be tested by the execution of a material test specification with results exchanged in a QA test specification result. Material lot properties may contain nested material lot properties.

id.description: An identification of a specific material class property.

description.description: Additional information about the material class property.

value.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

MaterialCapability.description: A representation of the capability of material that is committed, available, or unattainable for a specific time shall be used as a material capability. Material capability is used for material lots or sublots. This includes information that is associated with the functions of material and energy control and product inventory control. The currently available and committed material capability is the inventory. WIP (work in progress) is a material capability currently under the control of production.

materialClassId.description: Identifies the associated material class of the capability.

materialDefinitionId.description: Identifies the associated material definition of the capability.

materialLotId.description: Identifies the associated material lot of the capability.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the material capability definition.

capabilityType.description: The capability type: Used, Unused, Total, Available, Unattainable, or Committed.

reason.description: Defines the reason for the capability type.

confidenceFactor.description: A measure of the confidence of the capacity value.

hieararchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.  If omitted, then the capability is associated to the parent operations capability hierarchy scope.   Zero or more as required to identify the specific scope of the operations capability definition.

materialUse.description: Defines the expected capability use of the material. For example, Consumed, Produced, or Consumable.

startTime.description: The starting time associated with the material capability.   If omitted, then the capability is associated to the parent operations capability start time.

endTime.description: The ending time associated with the material capability.   If omitted, then the capability is associated to the parent operations capability end time.

quantity.description: Specifies the quantity of the material capability defined, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the material quantity, if applicable.

MaterialCapabilityProperty.description: Material capability properties may contain nested material capability properties.

id.description: An identification of a property of the associated material property or equipment class property.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the material capability property definition.

value.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

quantity.description: Specifies the quantity of the material capability defined, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated quantity.

SpatialDefinition.description: The spatial definition provides a means of communicating 0-dimensional point, 1-dimensional line, or 2-dimensional shape or 3-dimensional solid geospatial location data for planning/scheduling, actuals, resources, and analytics. Spatial definition identifies a value and the pre-defined coordinate reference system using following attributes a)  value; b)  format; c)  spatial reference identifier (SRID); and d)  SRID authority. A fully qualified spatial definition exchange has all 4 attributes as a minimum.  In some information exchanges, sending and receiving applications may have a specified agreement on format, SRID, and SRID authority. Spatial definition is distinct from, and separate to storage location and physical location. Storage location attribute is defined for material lots and material sublots as a non-spatial definition of location. The physical location attribute logically identifies a “place” which is actual physical location of the physical asset.

value.description: A string serialization EXAMPLE 1 UN/CEFACT CCTS: TextType) of the geospatial information in the format indicated in the format attribute.

format.description: An enumerator that determines the format of the value attribute.

srid.description: SRID is the Spatial Reference Identifier which identifies the coordinate reference system to identify a pre-defined coordinate reference system (pre-configured into communication systems). An identifier from the SRID Authority.

sridAuthority.description: The SRID authority identifies the authority that defines the coordinate reference system identified by the SRID. EXAMPLE 2 EPSG (see http://www.epsg-registry.org/). An organization may choose to define its own SRIDs. EXAMPLE 3 Reference its own authority.
